column5: If you were going to make the trip and spend the bucks, which lodge / resort / camp would you choose? I am looking at putting a trip together with a few friends for 2016 and any insights, positive or negative welcome. Feel free to PM if you don't wish to broadcast Thanks
PM sent,whatever you decide it is best to book asap as the good lodges fill up quick
There's a ton of info on walleye central about lac seul

Whichever one had the nicest boats or maybe a boat-in or island lodge.  All the lodges on Lac Seul are quite popular.   Gawley's Little Beaver, Frog Rapids, Golden Eagle, White Wing, Evergreen, Goose Bay, Silver Water Wheel get mentioned often.

There's a ton of info on walleye central about lac seul  +1.  Check out the "Canada Eh?" forum.  Its mostly Americans planning trips to Canada and LS is a top destination (for obvious reasons!)  http://www.walleyecentral.com/forums/forumdisplay.php?f=7  Let us know who you chose and a little fishing/lodge report would be nice
All depends on what you're fishing for...   So what are you fishing for? lol
Silver Water Wheel is the one I would choose.

Thanks all for the feedback and pms. Much appreciated All depends on what you're fishing for...   So what are you fishing for? lol Ideally - multi-species. "Decent quantity, occasional trophy would  be a bonus"  sums up the mind set for this outing  Silver Water Wheel is the one I would choose. Thanks Mike - still working through the list you sent me too.  Gonna be a tough decision.
You cannot screw up lac seul.  If you do, quit fishing.  Unreal fishery
haha...quit fishing. I can't help you, but sounds like a fantastic place to go

I would 2nd Silver Water Wheel. The area is less crowded. I love that section of the lakeâ€¦.its my hunting ground. Dryden only 40 minutes away if not towing, road was done last year and is still in pretty good shape.
